text: Gregory V (; c. 972-18 February 999), also known as Bruno of Carinthia, was a German priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 139th Pope from 3 May 996 to 18 February 999. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2013-3-20. ==Early life== Bruno of Carinthia was a son of Otto I, Duke of Carinthia. He was made chaplain of the Holy Roman Emperor Otto III. "Pope Gregory V," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-20. ==Pope== Bruno was elected pope in 996; and he chose to be called Gregory. He was the first German Pope.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1838). "Gregory V," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 11, p. 444. ==Related pages== * List of popes * List of ages of popes ==References== ==Other websites== * * "Gregory V", Encyclop√¶dia Britannica, 1911 * Catholic Hierarchy, Popes in sequence Category:German popes Category:972 births Category:999 deaths
title: Pope Gregory V
